Euclase Tutorial

Euclase is a prototype for a development environment for creating interactive applications for the Web.

This tutorial will guide you through some of its current features through a series of examples. We seek any feedback (especially feature ideas) that come to mind. Please e-mail soney@cs.cmu.edu with any feedback or questions.

Because Euclase is a web-based IDE, throughout this tutorial, you'll find in-line code examples, which are indicated by a red border:

(Euclase code here)

You'll also find code output in a blue border:

(Output here)

And sometimes you'll see the code and its output:

(Euclase code here)
(Output here)
Let's start!
